info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 9 at 10:07PM EDT until July 10 at 7:59AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Delaware...
Red Clay Creek At Wooddale affecting New Castle County.
For the Red Clay Creek...including Wooddale...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red Clay Creek at Wooddale.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Flooding begins in adjacent open fields. At 7.5 feet, Barley Mill Road begins to flood. Brandywine Springs Park floods. At 8.5 feet, Flooding begins near Old Capital Trail and Newport Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Wednesday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 8.4 feet late this evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.4 feet on 03/28/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 800 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
